tags: it's interesting to see which character dynamics are highlighted on these playlists
summary: “Here Come the Runts” feels like a really interesting take on the Mighty Nein, and it kind of makes me love Beauregard’s...
body:
“Here Come the Runts” feels like a really interesting take on the Mighty Nein, and it kind of makes me love Beauregard’s development into a person who cares for her crew even more.

Molly and Jester, tieflings who are out of place most places they go.

Nott the Brave, a goblin. Enough said.

Caleb, quiet hobo wizard who can’t put up a fight.

Fjord, who filed down his tusks and faked an accent to feel more at home.

And Beau, whose parents wanted a son and kept their daughter inside.

“Okay I am a runt
Baby you are a runt
Baby we are the runts”

blog.name: tiamat-zx
blog.title: Adam's CR Blog
blog.description: 32 years old, male, Critter, YouTuber, level 6 eldritch knight, video gamer, let's player, Vaxleth shipper, Critical Role fan, and just a guy wanting to voice his opinion.

title: Power, Temptation, Corruption
body:
“Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely. Great men are almost always bad men, even when they exercise influence and not authority: still more when you superadd the tendency or the certainty of corruption by authority. There is no worse heresy than that the office sanctifies the holder of it. That is the point at which … the end learns to justify the means.”

I think it’s safe to say that these immortal words from Baron John Acton’s famous 4/5/1887 letter to Archbishop Mandell Creighton perfectly summarize Fjord’s current situation going into the end of the year.

Fjord may not have started out as a bad man, but he’s definitely showing signs of slipping. I mean, look at how much he’s changed compared to Beauregard. It’s as if they’ve completely had their roles reversed. Now she’s the one concerned for others, willing to slowly come out of her shell and start showing how she really feels and wanting to connect with everyone… and he’s become much more condescending and snappish, as noted when he continued to disregard Nott’s fear of water AND when he simply called her “Goblin”. And the not-so-subtle manipulations he’s been using to “convince” her to help out. I know they’ve had a rocky, borderline antagonistic relationship since the early episodes but… wow. Also, the blatant disregard he’s had now for many of the party’s concerns.

The fact that the Nein were for the most part encouraging him to do what he had to do while they were under Avantika’s “care” doesn’t help matters either, I’ll admit. But they also couldn’t have foreseen that things would turn out like this, that he would change so much during this arc.

And while it excites me to see where this may go, it also worries me. How far is too far for Fjord, if there even is such a limit at this point? And how much will the others take before deciding that enough is enough and try to drag him back? And despite his claims that he will stop pursuing this once they insert the second crystal, I find it very hard to believe that he will.

That being said, if Travis is intentionally RPing Fjord this way, and not just playing off of 7 Wisdom, then it’s a pretty awesome power move.

What are your thoughts?

“Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely. There is no worse heresy than that the office sanctifies the holder of it. That is the point at which … the end learns to justify the means.”

I think it’s safe to say that these immortal words from Baron John Acton’s famous 4/5/1887 letter to Archbishop Mandell Creighton perfectly summarize Fjord’s current situation going into the end of the year.

blog.name: yfere
blog.title: just muddling through
blog.description: Alcin, 22. they/them. Critical Role and assorted nonsense

summary:
Shipping Calculus: Live Updates
For C2E46, because despite me saying "I'm not a big shipper lawl" my math brain ("math" brain)...
body:
Shipping Calculus: Live Updates

For C2E46, because despite me saying “I’m not a big shipper lawl” my math brain (“math” brain) won’t let me rest when there are Calculations to be made

So in this episode, we have

+1 to Caduceus/Caleb, because Cad was Really Bent on getting Caleb that book, but unfortunately Caleb was not in a headspace to be properly appreciative. Overall the exchange had the same energy as my parents getting me a coffeemaker for Christmas, and I’m like, “Okay, you were obviously thinking of me when you got this, but…I don’t want it…”

+1 to Fjord/Caleb because Fjord is also tuned into getting Caleb Paper and Food and even made an undead specter in a severely misguided attempt to take the scouting burden off of Frumpkin. Caleb does not know what the proper reaction is to this. Is he supposed to be grateful? Disturbed? Awkward thumbs up it is.

Possible +0 (or +2? Hard to tell) because Caleb is still suffering from Fjord-related guilt on multiple levels, only compounded by Nott’s insistence that Caleb stop him before he goes evil. ((Because you did so well at that last time, huh, Caleb? Because you’ve aided and abetted every questionable decision this poor man has made, haven’t you, Caleb? Because thinking about Fjord instead of Nott nearly lost you Nott the other day, didn’t it Caleb?)) He’s just weakly doubling down on the “You’re calling the shots” mantra at this point, but he is clearly Suffering

-20 to Fjord/Jester, because in spite of Fjord trying very hard to patch things up and explain himself, Jester just Does Not Believe he has any feelings of any kind for her anymore. She remains upset over his dangerous impulsiveness, and things only get worse once he starts snapping at Jester to fix sails instead of get tea.

+30 to Jester/Beau. Beau was THERE for Jester, and they had a deep conversation, and they UNDERSTAND each other, and they HUGGED, and they exchanged “I love yous!” This is the true birth of the Lavorregard ship.

+0 or +1 to Beau/Yasha, because while we got Yasha Lore, Beau was not around to hear it. While Yasha was confirmed wlw, she was also confirmed as a widow in severe grief, reluctant to even make friends (let alone lovers) after what she lost.

+100 Caduceus/Every Single NPC That blacksmith is to be commended for the courage to ask for what everyone must always be thinking when they meet Cad. Hugs away

BONUS: For all of you talking to me about forgetting Molly, I can Definitively Say that according to calculations he remains the Absolute Least Shippable of the M9. Because he’s dead. 

Anyway, message me with missing variables!

summary: I have no idea why everyone is calling Fjord a bastard man, and you know what? I love it so much, because Travis Willingham can...
body:
I have no idea why everyone is calling Fjord a bastard man, and you know what? I love it so much, because Travis Willingham can play jerks really well, like:

Love my Roy Mustang, but he’s an asshole.

blog.name: cr-cast-reactions-daily
blog.title: Critical Role Cast Reactions
blog.description:
Feel free to submit any reactions you might have and want to share

Please ask if you can use my photos as your icon

tags: i mean imagine if he’d said that to Beau or Jester?
summary: I don’t know what it says about Yasha that when Caduceus casually told her that his sister smashed his knee, her reaction was...
body:
I don’t know what it says about Yasha that when Caduceus casually told her that his sister smashed his knee, her reaction was “yeah okay that seems fine.”

Or what it says about Caduceus that he ALSO apparently thinks that’s fine?

What the hell, you two?

reblog.comment:
I don’t know what it says about Yasha that when Caduceus casually told her that his sister smashed his knee, her reaction was “yeah okay that seems fine.”

Or what it says about Caduceus that he ALSO apparently thinks that’s fine?

What the hell, you two?

What the hell, you two?
